title: This Off-Duty Model Hoodie From Everlane Is on Sale
text:
1 item in this article Photo: Courtesy of the vendor

Here at the Strategist, we like a cropped hoodie tied in a dainty bow at the neck and paired with high-waisted pants. It’s, as Strategist editor Katy Schneider dubbed it, “the Off-Duty Model Drawstring Thing (ODMDT).” Cut fashion writer Emila Petrarca explained the trend: “Raf does some avant-garde thing, Virgil makes a streetwear version, and then everyone does it.” Everlane, it turns out, makes an ideal ODMDT shrunken hoodie — it comes in six muted shades and has a seam along the shoulders that lends it a vintage feel. And right now, just in time for sweatshirt season, it’s on sale for 30 percent off. We’d like to note that there are some Everlane high-waisted cropped flares for 40 percent off to wear it with.
